docs.snippet: THE HELTH OFFICE CONTEST-A COU??'ETAT, -It is well known that since May last there have been two medical gentlemen, Dr. SAMUEL k. BOYD and Dr. WARREN CLEVELAND, who claim to held the important position of Health Officer to the city of Brooklyn, The...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE HELTH OFFICE CONTEST-A COU??'ETAT, -It is well known that since May last there have been two medical gentlemen, Dr. SAMUEL k. BOYD and Dr. WARREN CLEVELAND, who claim to held the important position of Health Officer to the city of Brooklyn, The former gentleman has been backed in his claim to the office by the Common Council.

docs.snippet: WASSINGTON MARKET FILTH.--When the Harbor Commissioners called the attention of the City authorities to the filthy condition of Washington Market Pier and its surroundings, there were over 7,000 cart.loads of manure and City filth deposited there....

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; The way of Life--Mr. Edgar's Statement. Police Intelligence. Mayor's Office. FATAL ACCIDENT ON A STEAMER. MAOYR'S VOTES.. DROWNED.--JEREMIAH M. LYMAN,

docs.lead_paragraph: WASSINGTON MARKET FILTH.--When the Harbor Commissioners called the attention of the City authorities to the filthy condition of Washington Market Pier and its surroundings, there were over 7,000 cart.loads of manure and City filth deposited there. This has been ascertained by actual measurement. A portion of this mountain of manure has been removed. but it is still resorted to by gentlemen who use the freedom of the City.

headline.main: THE ATLANTIC TELEGRAPH.; When the Line will be opened for Business. Sailing of the Niagara for New-York. Latest Dispalehes from Cyras W. Field. GRAND BALL AND BANQUET AT ST, JOHNS,

docs.lead_paragraph: To the New York Associated Press : On the Wednesday before I left London, the Directors of the Atlantic Telegraph Company unanimously decided that after the cable was laid and the Queen's and President's messages transmitted, the line should be kept free for several weeks, solely for the ue of Dr. WHITEHOUSE, Prof. THOMPSON and other

docs.snippet: At 12 o'clock, yesterday, a large number of the members of the New-York Bar gathered in the General Term room of the Superior Court, for the purpose of giving a formal expression of their appreciation of the loss the Bench and the Bar have sustained...

headline.main: DEATH OF JUDGE DUER.; Meeting of the Bar--Remarks of JudgeBosworth, B. F. Butler, Hiram Keichum and James T. Brady-Funeral Ceremonies.

docs.lead_paragraph: At 12 o'clock, yesterday, a large number of the members of the New-York Bar gathered in the General Term room of the Superior Court, for the purpose of giving a formal expression of their appreciation of the loss the Bench and the Bar have sustained in the death of Chief-Justice DUER. The meeting was called to order by Ex-Judge BRONSON, who nominated for President, Judge BOSWORTH, now Chief-Justice of the Superior Court.

docs.snippet: The Cunard Steamship Niagara, with three days' later news from Europe, is now fully due at Halifax from Liverpool. There were no signs of her at 11 o'clock last night. The arrangements for working the Atlantic Telegraph are now probably entirely...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Cunard Steamship Niagara, with three days' later news from Europe, is now fully due at Halifax from Liverpool. There were no signs of her at 11 o'clock last night. The arrangements for working the Atlantic Telegraph are now probably entirely completed, in which case the message of Queen VICTORIA and the response of President BUCHANAN will be transmitted some time to-day.

docs.snippet: The ship Pepperel, of Saco, reported in yesterday's edition was from New-Orleans, which port she left July 23, bound to Bordeaux, with a cargo of staves. On the 7th Inst., when in lat. 30[Degrees] 39', Ion. 70?? 28, having but the chief officer, 4...
docs.lead_paragraph: The ship Pepperel, of Saco, reported in yesterday's edition was from New-Orleans, which port she left July 23, bound to Bordeaux, with a cargo of staves. On the 7th Inst., when in lat. 30[Degrees] 39', Ion. 70?? 28, having but the chief officer, 4 men and a boy able to do duty, and the vessel leaking badly, the ship's course was altered for New-York, where she arrived Monday evening in tow of steamer Achilles. Capt.

docs.snippet: COMMISSIONERS OF HEALTH.--The Board met on Monday. A petition was received from the Danish brig Res??, which arrived here from Porto Rico on the 6th inst., to come up to the City and discharge cargo, Granted for the 11th inst.
docs.lead_paragraph: COMMISSIONERS OF HEALTH.--The Board met on Monday. A petition was received from the Danish brig Res??, which arrived here from Porto Rico on the 6th inst., to come up to the City and discharge cargo, Granted for the 11th inst.

docs.snippet: Remove ten thousand Germans from an extraordinary musical festive; replace them with an equal number of Americans of the class that can't get away: crowd an ample orchard with human beings intent on wholesome amusement and determined to enjoyed...

headline.main: The Mammoth Festival-Great Gathering at Jones' Wood.

docs.lead_paragraph: Remove ten thousand Germans from an extraordinary musical festive; replace them with an equal number of Americans of the class that can't get away: crowd an ample orchard with human beings intent on wholesome amusement and determined to enjoyed themselves at any sacrifice--and you have and idea of the gay Picture presented yesterday at Jone's Wood.

headline.main: LATEST BY TELEGRAPH.; Interesting Miscellaneous Intelligence. Cotton Easier--Breadstuffs Quiet--Consols 95 5-8. The Prince Albert at This Port and the Arago off Cape Race. LATER FROM EUROPE.

docs.lead_paragraph: The screw steamship Prince Albert, whose advices, as telegraphed from Halifax, we published on Saturday morning, arrived at this port last night, about midnight. We find nothing of importance in the papers brought by her, additional to what was comprised in the dispatch.

docs.snippet: COMMISSIONERS OF HEALTH.--At the meeting of the Board on Saturday, Mr. Corlies, Superintendent of Repairs and Supplies, made a report and submitted a plan for the erection of a pier and sheds at Quarantine : also, for a series of warehouses two...
docs.lead_paragraph: COMMISSIONERS OF HEALTH.--At the meeting of the Board on Saturday, Mr. Corlies, Superintendent of Repairs and Supplies, made a report and submitted a plan for the erection of a pier and sheds at Quarantine : also, for a series of warehouses two stories high, with a railway running from the end of the pier.
